messages.message: Hey hey!  Not planning on opening north, so would appreciate no Churchill opening
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Hey hey!  Not planning on opening north, so would appreciate no Churchill opening'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. RUSSIA's reference to the Churchill opening and explicit mention of not planning to open north indicates an honest attempt to communicate intentions and preferences clearly.

messages.message: It took me a moment to look up what the Churchill opening is, and, I can guarantee you that won't happen. I hate opening LVP-EDI, to be honest. Sacrificing the ability to protect London goes against my every instinct.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'It took me a moment to look up what the Churchill opening is, and, I can guarantee you that won't happen. I hate opening LVP-EDI, to be honest. Sacrificing the ability to protect London goes against my every instinct.'.

messages.message: As the great teacher DQ once said, "Always open to Channel"
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'As the great teacher DQ once said, "Always open to Channel"'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. RUSSIA's reference to DQ's advice about the Channel opening, following ENGLAND's detailed response indicating dislike for the LVP-EDI move, suggests a lack of sincerity or alignment with the previous conversation, indicating a potential attempt at misdirection.

messages.message: *sigh*  Chris Martin would be so disappointed in your avoidance of the English Channel
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'*sigh*  Chris Martin would be so disappointed in your avoidance of the English Channel'.
messages.output: You should not trust the message. RUSSIA's reference to Chris Martin and disappointment in ENGLAND's avoidance of the English Channel seems like an attempt at humor or light-hearted communication without addressing the strategic content of the conversation, indicating a potential lack of seriousness in the message.

messages.message: As much as I love DQ, he isn't always right about everything.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'As much as I love DQ, he isn't always right about everything.'.

messages.message: Fair enough. I was going to send the video in chat, but damn is it hard to Google anything by someone who shares a name with anyone even remotely famous.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Fair enough. I was going to send the video in chat, but damn is it hard to Google anything by someone who shares a name with anyone even remotely famous.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. RUSSIA's acknowledgment of the difficulty in finding information about someone with a common name on Google demonstrates a relatable and genuine frustration, indicating a credible and authentic tone in the communication.

messages.message: Ooh, post-coffee now.  So, you've opened north.  I'm focusing south.  I really don't want to have to spend a lot of time and effort covering my northern dots. So what can we do to keep tensions low up there?
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'Ooh, post-coffee now.  So, you've opened north.  I'm focusing south.  I really don't want to have to spend a lot of time and effort covering my northern dots. So what can we do to keep tensions low up there?'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. RUSSIA's proactive approach in addressing the strategic situation, expressing a desire to keep tensions low in specific areas, demonstrates a cooperative and collaborative mindset, suggesting sincerity in the communication.

messages.message: Well I'm planning to build an army, and I'm not planning to put it in Norway. Do you want support into Sweden?
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'Well I'm planning to build an army, and I'm not planning to put it in Norway. Do you want support into Sweden?'.

messages.message: GDI,I hate this app. I never saw your comment, so I assumed you were being silent cause you were going to shuffle barents and Norway, so that tap was defensive. I see you're focused elsewhere, so it won't be repeated.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'GDI,I hate this app. I never saw your comment, so I assumed you were being silent cause you were going to shuffle barents and Norway, so that tap was defensive. I see you're focused elsewhere, so it won't be repeated.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. RUSSIA's frustration with the app, explanation of the misunderstanding regarding the previous actions, and commitment to not repeat certain moves convey a transparent and rationale response, indicating honesty and a genuine desire for clear communication and cooperation.

messages.message: In fact, can support to Sweden if you want.
messages.input: Message from RUSSIA:'In fact, can support to Sweden if you want.'.
messages.output: You should trust the message. RUSSIA's offer to support you into Sweden aligns with your previous question about supporting moves in that direction, indicating a cooperative and conciliatory approach towards working together.

messages.message: No problem at all! I would certainly appreciate that.
messages.input: My response to RUSSIA:'No problem at all! I would certainly appreciate that.'.

messages.output: You should trust the message. RUSSIA's concise response of "Done" after agreeing to support you into Sweden indicates a straightforward and immediate commitment to follow through on the offered support, reinforcing a sense of trust and reliability in the communication.
